frameDefinitions: The adjectives and nouns in this frame describe an Experiencer who is feeling or experiencing a particular emotional response to a Stimulus or about a Topic.
A Communicator (whose Location may be indicated) directs a Communication to an Addressee at a particular Address.
A Communicator conveys a Message to an Addressee; the Topic and Medium of the communication also may be expressed.
An Agent makes use of a Means (either an action or a (system of) entities standing in for the action) in order to achieve a Purpose.
This frame concerns Communicators communicating with each other with the aid of a Means of communication such as a telephone.
A Guest stays for a time at a Location, which is not his or her permanent residence, for some Duration.
frameExamples: Mr. Whiskers is <t>upset</t> that there are no more cat treats.
Disgruntled voters <t>phoned</t> Congressman Neil at his Washington residence with complaints about the recent increases in corporate welfare.
Let's hope it did n't have time to <t>communicate</t> any of its findings to its overlords.
The primary <t>means</t> of gas detection is mass spectroscopy .
I usually <t>stay</t> with my aunt at her summer house when I go to Seville.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a message to another person.
The person that receives the message from the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
This role is used for a (metaphorical) place in a system of communication where <fen>Communicator</fen>s and <fen>Addressee</fen>s can access the system.

The information that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wishes to impart to the <fen>Addressee</fen>, often to get a particular response. In this frame the <fen>Communication</fen> is not necessarily received by the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
This is the subject matter to which the message pertains. It is typically expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
This role identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.
The sentient entity that uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<fen>Message</fen> is a proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the communication takes place.
The location where the act of communication occurs.
The Agent uses the Means to acheive a Purpose.
The action performed by the Agent.
The goal or purpose of the Agent.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Means</fen>.

This role is the person who uses the <fen>Means</fen> of communication to deliver the <fen>Message</fen> to the Addressee. The Speaker is normally expressed as the External Argument of target verbs, or as the Genitive modifier of  nouns.

<fen>Addressee</fen> is the person to whom the <fen>Message</fen> is communicated. When this role is expressed, it often appears in a prepositional phrase introduced by to, or as the direct object, or as the first object in a double object construction.
This role identifies the content that the <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
<fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is typically expressed as a PP Complement headed by about.

This Frame Element refers to the Instrument of Communication that is used by the <fen>Communicator</fen> (and <fen>Addressee</fen>). Each LU in this frame incorporates the <fen>Means</fen> frame element.
The <fen>Guest</fen> remains for a relatively short period of time in the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Location</fen> where the <fen>Guest</fen> spends a short amount of time.
The length of time that the <fen>Guest</fen> remains at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Host</fen> is living at the <fen>Location</fen> on a permanent basis, and is allowing the <fen>Guest</fen> to stay there.
The time at which the temporary stay takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates the larger physical setting of the temporary stay.
listRoleExamples: Nan Ho turned, <fex>his</fex> extreme agitation unnoticed by the Prince.
I was angry <fex>about the war</fex>.
Liz's anger <fex>towards Raquel</fex> dates back to a charity dinner this year.
'Can I help you?' she asked, trying not to let him see the amusement <fex>in her blue eyes</fex>.
Tracy was in an irritated <fex>mood</fex>.
The end of the film was filled with jubilant <fex>scenes</fex>.
<fex>He</fex> wrote to John.
The company must be able to call <fex> potential customers</fex>.
You can telephone your senator <fex>at 555-5555</fex>.
Patients continually call in <fex>with questions</fex>.
Call John <fex>about the party</fex>.
<fex>He</fex> finds it hard to communicate with people, not least his separated parents .
How do you communicate to them <fex>that you really like them</fex> ?
Had someone communicated to the capital <fex>about the flagrant disregard of the religious law</fex> ?
Opinions are usually communicated <fex>over the telephone</fex> and are often given within 24 hours.
<fex>The President</fex> cabled his assistant to cancel all of his appointments.
The President cabled <fex>his assistant</fex> to cancel all other engagements.
Originally, <fex>we</fex> planned on rooming with our relatives in Reno.
Originally we planned on staying <fex>at the Hilton</fex>.
My wife and have just returned from a <fex>two day</fex> stay at Ocean Key.
You should avoid staying <fex>with old college buddies</fex> when on business trips.
He'll be lodging here <fex>next month</fex>.
<fex>In London</fex>, I stayed at a hotel.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Grave Circle A the graves of Cassandra and Agamemnon
